Object.Definition: An independent continuant (snap:IndependentContinuant) that is spatially extended, maximally self-connected and self-contained (the parts of a substance are not separated from each other by spatial gaps) and possesses an internal unity. The identity of substantial object (snap:Object) entities is independent of that of other entities and can be maintained through time., Synonyms: substance, Examples: an organism, a heart, a chair, a lung, an apple
